Description: Conical foot sherd of large Chian Mature Animal Style or Grand Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky black with trace of two bands in added colour (now lost); reserved edge of foot and underside; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: The thickness of the sherd suggests that it belongs to a large vessel like a heavy chalice. heavy chalices are found in the Mature Animal Style and Grand Style. The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.386.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 761, pl. XXI, no. 761)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 682, no. 412)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1609) (phase 2)
